Summary Note:
Mulders Voorn Willems and the RM met at a networking event in Amsterdam. They quickly realized they had complementary skills and decided to collaborate on several projects.
With a career spanning nearly 39 years, Mulders Voorn Willems has established himself as a key player in the industry.
Julius Baer's personalized approach and dedication to client success were key factors in his decision to join.
Family Background: Mulders Voorn Willems is currently divorced. His children are named Veenhoven and Spaans.
Education Background:
Mulders finished secondary school at VWO Dalton Den Haag in 1980.
Mulders pursued higher education at Koninklijk Nederlands Meteorologisch Instituut (KNMI), graduating in 1985.
He pursued addtionally further eduaction by attending Amsterdam University College and graduating in 1988.
Occupation History:
Mulders Voorn Willems is a 63 year old retired Conglomerate Owner from Netherlands.
Mulders Voorn Willems began his professional journey as a Plant Manager at Unilever N.V. in 1986, laying the foundation for future success.
He then transitioned to AkzoNobel N.V. as a Operations Director, leveraging his expertise to drive results from 1987 to 1991.
In 1991, he joined Royal Dutch Shell plc as a CEO, taking on new challenges and responsibilities that helped him grow both personally and professionally.
After 6 years of dedication, he assumed the role of Chairman at AkzoNobel N.V. in 1992, spearheading high-profile projects and mentoring junior colleagues.
He held the position of Conglomerate Owner at Heineken N.V. from 1995 until his retirement.
Wealth Summary:
While working, he saved 2390000 EUR, which he used to build a diversified investment portfolio.
He has house located in Delft, worth 1545000 EUR.

In addition to his primary residence, he owns condo in Emmen worth 1555000 EUR.

He does not have any inheritances.
Client Summary: Given the client's impressive career history and financial discipline, we are confident in his ability to achieve financial success and security.
